items.title: RDMkit on Your role
items.description: Best practice guidance regarding the different roles a professional can have in research data management.

items.title: Keynote: First FAIR steps, Rob Hooft
search_tags: Keynote: First FAIR steps, Rob Hooft
items.description: Video presentation about FAIR principles in life science research practice.

items.title: An Introduction to Data Management by Karin Granström (NBIS - SciLifeLab)
search_tags: An Introduction to Data Management by Karin Granström (NBIS - SciLifeLab)
items.description: Data Management, at its core ensures transparency, which is essential in research and especially for projects that are publicly funded. Karin Granström, a Data Steward at NBIS, will cover the basics of Data Management, best practices, and the considerations while drafting a Data Management Plan (DMP). The video is produced as part of the 'Nothing Lite about it!' series of talks produced by NGI Sweden and NBIS. The full playlist is available at https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLYGrAFgPpIzbZfkCyora4N1RavaaPizOS

items.title: Research Involving Human Data by Richelle Björvang
search_tags: Research Involving Human Data by Richelle Björvang
items.description: What do I as a researcher need to consider before I start working with human data? This talk covers the basics - definitions - and details on how to work with sensitive data. The video is produced as part of the 'Nothing Lite about it!' series of talks produced by NGI Sweden and NBIS. The full playlist is available at https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLYGrAFgPpIzbZfkCyora4N1RavaaPizOS

items.title: SciLifeLab Data Repository Metadata record tutorial
search_tags: SciLifeLab Data Repository Metadata record tutorial
items.description: Video presentation about how to submit a metadata record in SciLifeLab Data Repository in order to make sensitive data findable while still adhering to GDPR.

items.title: Handbook for data containing personal information
search_tags: Handbook for data containing personal information
items.description: Swedish National Data Service (SND) guidance on working with research data containing personal information.

items.title: ELSI checklist in Data Stewardship Wizard
search_tags: ELSI checklist in Data Stewardship Wizard
items.description: A checklist, implemented in Data Stewardship Wizard, that covers Ethical, Legal and Social Implications (ELSI) considerations when working with human data. Log in using your university credentials, click on **Projects** in the left sidebar, then on the **Create** button, and choose *ELSI Checklist Template*.

items.title: RDMkit on Documentation and metadata
items.description: Best practice guidance regarding the task of managing metadata.

items.title: Metadata
items.description: Training material regarding managing metadata, including metadata standards, data dictionaries, controlled vocabularies and ontologies.

items.title: Open Science and FAIR
items.description: Training material regarding what Open Science and FAIR principles mean.

items.title: RDMkit on Human data
items.description: Best practice guidance regarding working with human data.

items.title: DataCite Commons
items.description: Web search interface to works, people, organizations and repositories.

items.title: The Swedish COVID-19 Data Portal one year on
search_tags: The Swedish COVID-19 Data Portal one year on
items.description: Video presentation about the improved Swedish COVID-19 data portal.

items.title: Swedish COVID-19 Data Portal
items.description: Video presentation about the Swedish COVID-19 data portal by Arnold Kochari at SciLifeLab.

items.title: EBI repository wizard
items.description: The wizard guides through the decision process of finding a suitable repository.

items.title: EBI submission YouTube playlist
items.description: Collection of instruction videos on how to submit to the various repositories at EBI.

items.title: RDMkit on Reusing data
items.description: Best practice guidance regarding the phase of data reuse.

items.title: RDMkit on Existing data
items.description: Best practice guidance regarding the task of reusing data.

items.title: Google dataset search
items.description: Google search engine for finding data sets.

items.title: RDMkit on Preserving data
items.description: Best practice guidance regarding the phase of preserving data.

items.title: RDMkit on Sharing data
items.description: Best practice guidance regarding the phase of data sharing.

items.title: RDMkit on Data publication
items.description: Best practice guidance regarding the task of publishing data.

items.title: Data publication
items.description: Training material regarding the why and how of data publication.

items.title: RDMkit on Analysing data
items.description: Best practice guidance regarding the phase of data analysis.

items.title: Introduction to R
items.description: Training material introducing how to work with R and tidy data.

items.title: Versioning
items.description: Training material regarding versioning of data and code using Git.

items.title: Data organisation
items.description: Training material regarding good data organisation practices.

items.title: RDMkit on Processing data
items.description: Best practice guidance regarding the phase of processing data.

items.title: RDMkit on Data quality
items.description: Best practice guidance regarding the task of data quality management.

items.title: OpenRefine training
items.description: Training material regarding OpenRefine, a tool for cleaning tabular data.

items.title: RDMkit on Data Management Planning
items.description: Best practice guidance regarding the phase of data management planning.

items.title: DMP
items.description: Training material regarding the what, why, and how of data management plans.

items.title: RDMkit on Collecting data
items.description: Best practice guidance regarding the phase of collecting data.

items.title: RDMkit on Data transfer
items.description: Best practice guidance regarding the task of transferring data.

items.title: Aspera CLI install instructions
items.description: Aspera client is a command-line transfer program that can be used for stable transfers of files e.g. from NAISS storage to ENA (European Nucleotide Archive) upload area when doing submission.

items.title: Rclone documentation
items.description: Rclone is a command-line program that can be used to transfer files across a wide range of protocols. This can be useful when you you are unable to use specialised submission tools or Aspera, for example when transfering files in bulk to SciLifeLab Data Repository over the FTPS protocol.

items.title: SciLifeLab Data Stewardship Wizard (DSW)
items.description: Tool to create data management plans complying with requirements from Swedish research council while giving Life Science specific guidance.

items.title: DMPOnline
items.description: DMPonline is the Digital Curation Centre's data management planning tool. It provides tailored guidance and example answers to help researchers develop data management plans.

items.title: 17 Example DMPs hosted in DSW
items.description: 17 DMP examples using the templates created in DSW were written and reviewed by data stewards. They cover diverse data types and organisms, using a template aligned with the BBSRC Data Sharing Policy. All are hosted on the UK national DSW instance and available on Zenodo.

items.title: Introduction to data management practices
items.description: This course will introduce important aspects of Research Data Management (concept of FAIR, Metadata standards, Data Organisation, Data Publication, Data Management Planning, Data Refinement (Open Refine), Data Versioning, Programming/Analysis in R) through a series of lectures and hands-on computer exercises. The course is intended for researchers that want to take the first steps towards a more systematic and reproducible approach to analysing and managing research data. All lessons are available online as self-study materials

items.title: BAS Online
items.description: BAS Online is divided into six sessions consisting of short video presentations, exercises and other material such as texts and linked resources. The course is primarily aimed at those who work at a research data support unit at a Swedish university, and covers topics such as Data management and data management plans, Metadata, Metadata standards, Documentation of research data, Law and research data.

items.title: General information about research data on UU intranet
search_tags: General information about research data on UU intranet
items.description: General information about handling data - DMP, documentation & metadata, FAIR, organizing files & folders, versioning, ethical & legal aspects, open data, archiving. Information is mostly on a generic level, not discipline specific. Lectures in Phd courses on ethics and scientific writing. Target audience is researchers and doctoral students at UU.

items.title: Online course on Open science and data management
search_tags: Online course on Open science and data management
items.description: Online course available at all time with reflection and discussion material covering the topics of basic data management, DMP, management of open versus confidential data, basic legal and information security, sharing, publishing, and archiving. Target audience is PhD students and Researchers, with additional sections with material for leaders of larger collaborative projects (samverkansledare).

items.title: Data Management Expert Guide (DMEG)
items.description: The DMEG is designed by European experts to help social science researchers make their research data Findable, Accessible, Interoperable and Reusable (FAIR).

items.title: AIDA Data Sharing Policy
items.description: The AIDA (Analytical Imaging Diagnostics Arena) Data Sharing Policy is a comprehensive resource developed by ~50 AIDA partners in healthcare, industry, and academia, which includes legal analyses, best practices, and practical instructions for how to carry out ethically and legally correct sharing of sensitive personal data such as medical images in Sweden and similar countries.

items.title: AIDA Data Hub
items.description: The AIDA (Analytical Imaging Diagnostics Arena) Data Hub provides Data Sharing, Policy Support, and Services for researchers in Swedish medical imaging AI, and facilitates sharing of FAIR medical imaging research data for Open Science.

items.title: Storage resources available for researchers in Sweden
search_tags: Storage resources available for researchers in Sweden
items.description: Information page regarding storage resources available to researchers in Sweden, and how to apply for access.

items.title: Compute resources available for researchers in Sweden
search_tags: Compute resources available for researchers in Sweden
items.description: Information page regarding compute resources related to hosting, simulation, and analysis that are available to researchers in Sweden. It contains information about the services the resources provide, and how to apply for access to them.

items.title: Overview of available national and local computational resources
search_tags: Overview of available national and local computational resources
items.description: Information page regarding computational resources, giving an overview over available NAISS systems, other national systems, as well as local (university level) systems.

items.title: RDMkit on Data organisation
items.description: Best practice guidance regarding the task of organising data, in terms of naming files, file versioning, folder structure and file formats.

items.title: NBIS Submission documentation
items.description: Documentation on data submissions done by data stewards into public repositories, including standard operating procedures for submissions to ENA.

items.title: Data with personal information in DORIS
search_tags: Data with personal information in DORIS
items.description: Swedish National Data Service (SND) guidance on sharing data with personal information in DORIS.

items.title: The Swedish Reference Genome Portal
items.description: The Swedish Reference Genome Portal is a free national data service for aggregating, discovering, and visualising non-human eukaryotic genome assemblies and genome annotations (co-)produced by researchers affiliated with a Swedish institution.

items.title: OpenRefine
items.description: OpenRefine is a powerful free, open source tool for working with messy data: cleaning it; transforming it from one format into another; and extending it with web services and external data. There is training material available at https://nbisweden.github.io/module-openrefine-dm-practices/.

items.title: protocols.io
items.description: A secure platform for developing and sharing reproducible methods.

items.title: Infectious Diseases Toolkit on Data analysis
search_tags: Infectious Diseases Toolkit on Data analysis
items.description: Best practice guidance regarding the task of analyising data, in terms of employing workflows tailored to different types of data, such as epidemiological, clinical, or molecular data.

items.title: Infectious Diseases Toolkit on Data description
search_tags: Infectious Diseases Toolkit on Data description
items.description: Best practice guidance regarding the task of describing data, in terms of finding and adhering to relevant standards for (meta)data and documentation.

items.title: Infectious Diseases Toolkit on Quality control
search_tags: Infectious Diseases Toolkit on Quality control
items.description: Best practice guidance regarding the task of quality control, in terms of ensuring the accuracy and reliability of data collected and analysed.

items.title: Infectious Diseases Toolkit on Ethical, Legal, and Social Issues
items.short_title: IDTk: Ethical, Legal, and Social Issues
search_tags: Infectious Diseases Toolkit on Ethical, Legal, and Social Issues
items.description: Guidance on how to comprehensively assess the ethical, legal, and social implication (ELSI) aspects of your work throughout all stages of data management.

items.title: Researchdata.se
items.description: Researchdata.se is a national web portal where you can find, share, and reuse research data from a wide range of disciplines. The portal focuses on searchability and access to data, making it easy to navigate thousands of datasets to find what you are looking for.

items.title: DORIS
items.description: The Swedish National Data Service's Data Organisation and Information System (DORIS) is a tool for describing and making research data and metadata searchable in the national research data portal Researchdata.se. DORIS can be used throughout the process, from describing and publishing research data, to reusing or reviewing them.

items.title: SciLifeLab Open Science Software Checklist
items.description: This checklist provides essential steps for sharing and citing your research software. It covers everything from planning your software to ensuring others can find, understand, reuse, and contribute to your software, and how to ensure your work is credited.

items.title: Programming Formalisms: Turning scripters into computer scientists
search_tags: Programming Formalisms: Turning scripters into computer scientists
items.description: This course aims to give life scientists, bioinformaticians, and other scientists with some experience in programming and scripting an understanding of the underlying principles of software development, design, and programming.

items.title: Python Code Style Conventions
items.description: Understand the benefits of following community coding conventions. This is a part of the lesson 'Intermediate Research Software Development'.

items.title: Verifying Code Style Using Linters
items.description: Use code linting tools to verify a program’s adherence to a Python coding style convention. This is a part of the lesson 'Intermediate Research Software Development'.

items.title: Cookiecutter Data Science
items.description: Cookiecutter Data Science (CCDS) is a tool for setting up a data science project template that incorporates best practices.

items.title: Cookiecutter for Computational Molecular Sciences Python Packages
search_tags: Cookiecutter for Computational Molecular Sciences Python Packages
items.description: A cookiecutter template for those interested in developing Computational Molecular Sciences (CMS) packages in Python.

items.title: National guidelines for open science
items.description: The national guidelines for open science provide a common direction for how openness can be applied and further developed within the Swedish research system.

items.title: Research Software Quality Kit
items.description: Research Software Quality Toolkit (RSQKit) lists curated best practices in developing, collaborating on and improving the quality of research software. It is intended for use by researchers who code, research software engineers, those managing and procuring funding for projects with a large research software component, those running research infrastructures involving software and those developing research software related policy at organisations and in projects.
provider: European Virtual Institute for Research Software Excellence (EVERSE)

items.title: Long-term preservation
items.description: Swedish National Data Service (SND) guidance on Long-term preservation of data.

items.title: Rayner, D. (2025). Open Science in the Swedish context - Data reuse.
search_tags: Rayner, D. (2025). Open Science in the Swedish context - Data reuse.
items.description: Training material regarding data reuse, given by David Rayner (training coordinator at SND) during 'Open Science in the Swedish context' workshop held during May 2025. The material includes slides with speaker notes as well as exercises, covering the topic of finding, accessing and evaluating research data for reuse. DOI: 10.17044/scilifelab.29348669.v2

items.title: SCoRe user documentation on computational resources
search_tags: SCoRe user documentation on computational resources
items.description: Support for Computational Resources (SCoRe) provides user documentation on computer-related things such as High Performance Computational (HPC) clusters and storage, courses given on the topic, efficiency when using, etc.

items.title: A Quick Guide to Organizing Computational Biology Projects
search_tags: A Quick Guide to Organizing Computational Biology Projects
items.description: The author describes a good strategy to organizing files and directories and documenting progress. The guiding principle is that someone unfamiliar with your project should be able to look at your computer files and understand in detail what you did and why.

items.title: SciLifeLab services
items.description: At SciLifeLab, we provide access to a range of pioneering technologies in molecular biosciences. Together, our capabilities enable the scientific endeavours of users from academia, industry and health care. Dedicated staff scientists can offer support throughout the experimental process, from study design to data handling.

items.title: National Academic Infrastructure for Supercomputing in Sweden (NAISS)
search_tags: National Academic Infrastructure for Supercomputing in Sweden (NAISS)
items.description: The National Academic Infrastructure for Supercomputing in Sweden (NAISS) maintains advanced computing, artificial intelligence, and data services that support research ranging from fundamental research in mathematics or physics to climate modelling, the green transition, life science and economics.

items.title: SciLifeLab FAIR storage
items.description: SciLifeLab offers storage resources to support data-driven life science, they are collectively referred to as 'SciLifeLab FAIR Storage'. SciLifeLab FAIR Storage resources are intended to support data sharing in accordance with the FAIR principles. They are available for any project that advances knowledge and discovery within the field of Swedish data-driven life science.

items.title: Open Researcher and Contributor ID (ORCID)
items.description: ORCID is a free, unique, persistent identifier (PID) for individuals to use as they engage in research, scholarship, and innovation activities.

items.title: NAISS storage rounds
items.description: Storage resources are made available through storage rounds. There are different sizes of NAISS allocated rounds for centre storage and Swestore national storage, as well as local rounds at centres.

items.title: Swedish Pathogens Portal list of available data
search_tags: Swedish Pathogens Portal list of available data
items.description: Visit the Swedish Pathogens Portal in order to find publications about COVID-19/SARS-CoV-2 that involve at least one author affiliated with a Swedish research institution.

items.title: Registry of Research Data Repositories (re3data)
items.description: Search in the Registry of Research Data Repositories (re3data) to find discipline-specific repositories for your field.

items.title: ELIXIR Deposition Databases for Biomolecular Data
search_tags: ELIXIR Deposition Databases for Biomolecular Data
items.description: ELIXIR has compiled a list of resources that it recommends for the deposition of experimental data.

items.title: European Nucleotide Archive (ENA)
items.description: The European Nucleotide Archive (ENA) hosts an instance of the Sequence Read Archive (SRA), the same archive that exists on NCBI. SRA accepts raw sequence data from any sequencing platform, generated in any research project.

items.title: BioStudies
items.description: BioStudies database contains descriptions of biological studies and is especially suited for linking a study to datasets in different repositories. However, it can also be used to describe sensitive data that has not been uploaded to a repository.

items.title: ArrayExpress
items.description: The functional genomics data collection (ArrayExpress), stores data from high-throughput functional genomics experiments, and provides data for reuse to the research community. In line with community guidelines, a study typically contains metadata such as detailed sample annotations, protocols, processed data and raw data. Raw sequence reads from high-throughput sequencing studies are brokered to the European Nucleotide Archive (ENA), and links are provided to download the sequence reads from ENA. Data can be submitted to the ArrayExpress collection through its dedicated submission tool, Annotare.

items.title: European Genome-phenome Archive (EGA)
items.description: European Genome-phenome Archive (EGA) is a service for sharing personally identifiable genetic and phenotypic data resulting from biomedical research projects. The repository is hosted by the European Bioinformatics Institute (EMBL-EBI) and the Centre for Genomic Regulation (CRG). Any data submitted to the repository is subject to controlled access, which means that access to the data only will be granted after a formal application procedure.

items.title: Federated European Genome-phenome Archive Sweden
items.description: FEGA Sweden is a repository for storing and sharing personally identifiable genetic and phenotypic data in Sweden in a way that meets the requirements of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). It is part of the Federated European Genome-phenome Archive, which is a network consisting of several national nodes and the European Genome-phenome Archive (EGA). Researchers can create a submission request by filling in a form on the website

items.title: BioImage Archive
items.description: The BioImage Archive is a free, publicly available online resource which stores and distributes biological images. It accepts submissions of data from any imaging modality, as long as the data are either associated with a peer-reviewed publication, or of value beyond a single experiment.

items.title: MetaboLights
items.description: MetaboLights is a database for Metabolomics experiments and derived information. The database is cross-species, cross-technique and covers metabolite structures and their reference spectra as well as their biological roles, locations and concentrations, and experimental data from metabolic experiments.

items.title: PRoteomics IDEntifications Database (PRIDE)
items.description: PRIDE admits protein and peptide identification/quantification data with the accompanying mass spectra evidence and any other related data types.

items.title: PeptideAtlas
items.description: PeptideAtlas is a multi-organism, publicly accessible compendium of peptides identified in a large set of tandem mass spectrometry proteomics experiments. PeptideAtlas admits SRM/MRM data that does not fit into PRIDE (targeted datasets).

items.title: FAIRsharing
items.description: FAIRsharing is a registry that collects metadata standards, databases and policies. It serves as a curated, informative and educational resource on data and metadata standards, inter-related to databases and data policies.

items.title: KI Data Repository
items.description: KI Data Repository is a data repository where Karolinska Institutet's (KI's) researchers can store, publish and share data.

items.title: KTH Data Repository
items.description: The KTH Data Repository is a general data repository offered as a service from KTH Royal Institute of Technology. The service offers a solution for depositing and preparing documentation and static versions of data and source code for your research project. Deposited data can be kept for internal archive or published as open data.

items.title: SciLifeLab Data Repository
items.description: The SciLifeLab Data Repository, powered by Figshare and supported by SciLifeLab and the Knut and Alice Wallenberg foundation through the Data-Driven Life Science (DDLS) program, is a repository for publishing any kind of research-related data, e.g. documents, figures, or presentations. Figshare is an open data repository used by researchers in numerous disciplines. Through an agreement with Figshare, SciLifeLab offers researchers and units the opportunity to upload and publish their research data through a dedicated portal.

items.title: Stockholm University Figshare
items.description: Stockholm University Figshare  is a repository for publishing any kind of research-related data, e.g. documents, figures, or presentations. Figshare is an open data repository used by researchers in numerous disciplines. Through an agreement with Figshare, Stockholm University offers researchers the opportunity to upload and publish their research data through a dedicated portal.

items.title: Guide for submission of metabarcoding data to ENA
search_tags: Guide for submission of metabarcoding data to ENA
items.description: This is a guide on how to submit sequence reads from environmental samples to ENA, provided by the Swedish Biodiversity Data Infrastructure (SBDI). The guide describes interactive submission via the Webin portal, with pointers on issues specific to submission of metabarcoding data, as well as on more general matters that may confuse first-time contributors.

items.title: European Nucleotide Archive (ENA) user documentation
items.description: Guidelines for submission and retrieval for the European Nucleotide Archive.

items.title: Annotare - ArrayExpress submission tool
items.description: Annotare is a tool for submitting functional genomics data to the ArrayExpress collection in BioStudies. It generates MAGE-TAB format and supports high metadata standards in compliance with MIAME/MINSEQE/MINSCE guidelines.

items.title: PRIDE Submission Tool
items.description: The PRIDE Submission Tool (also know as PX Submission Tool) is the main tool used to submit proteomics datasets to PRIDE Archive. This tool has been implemented as a wizard, guiding submitters through a set of simple steps to complete each dataset submission.

items.title: How to submit data to PRIDE
search_tags: How to submit data to PRIDE
items.description: PRIDE resources documentation on how to submit.

items.title: PASSEL - PeptideAtlas submission tool
items.description: The PeptideAtlas SRM Experiment Library (PASSEL) is a component of the PeptideAtlas project that is designed to enable submission, dissemination, and reuse of SRM experimental results from analysis of biological samples.

items.title: Figshare
items.description: Figshare is an open data, general-purpose, repository used by researchers in numerous disciplines. It can be used for sharing basically any kind of data, but also for just describing data stored elsewhere.

items.title: Zenodo
items.description: Zenodo is an open data, general-purpose, repository operated by CERN. It can be used for sharing basically any kind of data, but also for just describing data stored elsewhere.

items.title: EUDAT - B2SHARE
items.description: B2SHARE is a user-friendly, reliable and trustworthy way for researchers, scientific communities and citizen scientists to store, publish and share research data in a FAIR way.

items.title: The FAIR Data Principles
items.description: FORCE11 describe FAIR - a set of guiding principles to make data Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, and Reusable. The term FAIR was launched at a Lorentz workshop in 2014, the resulting FAIR principles were published in 2016.

items.title: ENA checklists
items.description: European Nucleotide Archive sample metadata checklists. There is a minimum amount of information required during ENA sample registration and all samples must conform to a defined checklist of expected metadata values. The most suitable checklist for sample registration depends on the type of the sample.

items.title: How to make a data dictionary
search_tags: How to make a data dictionary
items.description: Open Science Framework (OSF) support on how to make a data dictionary. A data dictionary is critical to making your research more reproducible because it allows others to understand your data. The purpose of a data dictionary is to explain what all the variable names and values in your spreadsheet really mean.

items.title: Ontology Lookup Service (OLS)
items.description: The Ontology Lookup Service (OLS) is a repository for biomedical ontologies that aims to provide a single point of access to the latest ontology versions. You can browse the ontologies through the website as well as programmatically via the OLS API. OLS is developed and maintained by the Samples, Phenotypes and Ontologies Team (SPOT) at EMBL-EBI.

items.title: Open Biological and Biomedical Ontology Foundry
search_tags: Open Biological and Biomedical Ontology Foundry
items.description: The mission of the OBO Foundry is to develop a family of interoperable ontologies that are both logically well-formed and scientifically accurate.

items.title: ZOOMA ontology annotation
items.description: ZOOMA is a service to assist in mapping data to ontologies in OLS.

items.title: Ontobee
items.description: A linked data server designed for ontologies. Ontobee is aimed to facilitate ontology data sharing, visualization, query, integration, and analysis. Ontobee dynamically dereferences and presents individual ontology term URIs to (i) HTML web pages for user-friendly web browsing and navigation, and to (ii) RDF source code for Semantic Web applications.

items.title: Data Protection Impact Assessment tool from CNIL
search_tags: Data Protection Impact Assessment tool from CNIL
items.description: The PIA software aims to help data controllers build and demonstrate compliance to the GDPR. The tools is available in French and in English. It facilitates carrying out a data protection impact assessment.

items.title: Bianca user guide
items.description: Bianca is one of the UPPMAX clusters, suitable for working with sensitive data.

items.title: Swedish Research Council - Good research practice (2024)
search_tags: Swedish Research Council - Good research practice (2024)
items.description: Good Research Practice provides orientation in the ethical principles and regulations that are important for research, and clarifies the responsibility that different actors have. It also provides guidance for reflection on ethics throughout the research process - from planning to implementation and publication.

items.title: SciLifeLab Precision Medicine Portal
items.description: The SciLifeLab Precision Medicine Portal is a service for researchers in the precision medicine field, designed to support and accelerate data-driven life science research in Sweden.

items.title: SciLifeLab PM Portal: Introduction to OMOP-CDM
search_tags: SciLifeLab PM Portal: Introduction to OMOP-CDM
Observational Medical Outcomes Partnership Common Data Model
items.description: The Observational Medical Outcomes Partnership Common Data Model (OMOP-CDM) is an open, community-driven standard designed to harmonize the structure and content of observational data, making it easier to compare and analyse across different sources.

items.title: OMOP Common Data Model
search_tags: Observational Medical Outcomes Partnership Common Data Model
Observational Health Data Sciences and Informatics
items.description: The Observational Medical Outcomes Partnership (OMOP) Common Data Model (CDM) is an open community data standard, designed to standardize the structure and content of observational data and to enable efficient analyses that can produce reliable evidence. This website is meant to serve as a resource describing the specification of the available versions of the Common Data Model.

items.title: Openscience.se
search_tags: Association of Swedish Higher Education Institutions
items.description: This portal collects essential information about the key actors, resources, and documents that are central to Sweden’s transition to an open science system.
